column4: I'm trying to install a GeForce FX 5500 and when I do "sudo nvidia-glx-config enable" I get this error: "Error: your X configuration has been altered.
This script cannot proceed automatically."
any help?
please I need to make this thing work.
yeah, I can help (someone!) do this: in a terminal, type gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf, and paste all of that into paste.ubuntu-nl.org
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/9700
I haven't gone away, the job calls for a sec, I'll be back in less than 5
ok, I'll try something, if it didn't work I'll be back.
hi, I'm back with no luck.
sudo aptitude install nvidia-glx nvidia-settings linux-restricted-modules-$(uname -r)
I've been lurking :)
thanks., let me try
after you've done that, come back
ok
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/9704
there should have been *some* reference to the packages on the command line; where are they?
nope
I have changed the nv for nvidia in xorg.conf but when it wants to run it tries to start but the logo seems out of reslution and it freezes there.
and when I try glxgears it says "segmentation fault"
hm, what nvidia card do you have?
eVGA GeForce FX 5500
then I cannot understand, why the aptitude install line I gave you, along with changing nv to nvidia in xorg.conf didn't work. It's worked so many times
that's what I don't understand. I had an old legacy one and it worked fine when I changed the nv to nvidia.
try nvidia-glx-legacy, then. Don't make sense to me, though.
